abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Food
            Security Support Project for Niger is to support the
            recipient's efforts to mitigate the impact of the food
            crisis by: (a) increasing the production of rice in
            irrigated farmlands; and (b) enhancing its capacity to
            respond adequately to future food security threats. The
            grant will help finance the costs associated with urgent
            procurement and distribution of fertilizer for irrigated
            rice production. Irrigated rice is the only crop that can
            respond effectively to soil fertilization at this period of
            the cropping season and which can rapidly increase food
            availability. The support will also benefit the Food Crisis
            Coordination Unit (CCA) in the Prime Minister's office,
            which is the permanent secretariat for the national Food
            Crisis Prevention and Management Framework (FCPMF), and
            other national bodies involved in the FCPMF, by providing
            technical assistance to strengthen monitoring of the food
            security situation and to prepare and implement social
            safety nets programs. Project preparation and implementation
            are coordinated with the Joint Government-Donor Food Crisis
            Committee (CRC) which oversees the CCA. Net sales revenues
            of fertilizers will be used to strengthen social safety nets programs.
